## Summary
:::note
This rule is currently only available in the [2.0 beta release](/blog/biome-v2-0-beta).
:::
- Diagnostic Category: [`lint/nursery/useParseIntRadix`](/reference/diagnostics#diagnostic-category)
- This rule has an [**unsafe**](/linter/#unsafe-fixes) fix.
- The default severity of this rule is [**information**](/reference/diagnostics#information).
- Sources: 
  - Same as [`radix`](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/radix)

:::caution
This rule is part of the [nursery](/linter/rules/#nursery) group.
:::
## Description
Enforce the consistent use of the radix argument when using `parseInt()`.

When using the `parseInt()` function it is common to omit the second argument, the radix, and let the function try to determine from the first argument what type of number it is. By default, `parseInt()` will autodetect decimal and hexadecimal (via `0x` prefix). Prior to ECMAScript 5, `parseInt()` also autodetected octal literals, which caused problems because many developers assumed a leading `0` would be ignored.

This confusion led to the suggestion that you always use the radix parameter to `parseInt()` to eliminate unintended consequences.

## Examples

### Invalid

```js
parseInt("071");
```

```js

```

```js
parseInt("071", 37);
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.js:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/use-parse-int-radix">lint/nursery/useParseIntRadix</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Invalid radix parameter</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>parseInt(&quot;071&quot;, 37);<br />   <strong>   │ </strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>2 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Radix must be a non-fractional number between 2 and 36</span><br />  <br /></code></pre>

```js
parseInt();
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.js:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/use-parse-int-radix">lint/nursery/useParseIntRadix</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This call to </span><span style="color: lightgreen;"><strong>parseInt</strong></span><span style="color: lightgreen;"> has no arguments, it will always return </span><span style="color: lightgreen;"><strong>NaN</strong></span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>parseInt();<br />   <strong>   │ </strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>2 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Add arguments to this function call</span><br />  <br /></code></pre>

### Valid

```js
parseInt("071", 10);
parseInt("071", 8);
parseFloat(someValue);
```

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"nursery": {
				"useParseIntRadix": "error"
			}
		}
	}
}

```
